name: Water Bottles (U.S.) Online Trivia | Food & Drink | 10 Questions

questions.text: In the US, what are most water bottles made of?
questions.explanation:
Plastic.

	Plastic is typically the chosen material used to make water bottles.  Some water comes in different flavors, but whatever they are, it is usually made in plastic.  There is paper on most water bottles, but it is just the label, not the entire water bottle itself.

questions.text: What is recommended you do to empty water bottles?
questions.explanation:
Recycle them.

	Most water bottles will specifically say to recycle them.  In the US, it shows a symbol at the bottom of the bottle of a triangle made of three turning arrows.  This is the recycling symbol.

questions.text: Which of these drink companies makes Lifewater?
questions.explanation:
SoBe.

	Lifewater is loaded with vitamins and minerals.  In fact, one bottle will give you 250% daily value of vitamin c!  This water has over 10 vital nutrients, most of which has at least 20% of the daily value.  SoBe was first introduced in 1996, and became part of Pepsi products in 2000.  SoBe is also known for their bottle caps, because they all have phrases on them.  There are over 200 phrases, including "Wasssssobe?," "Apocolizard Now," and, my favorite, "Sobe Wan Kenobi."

questions.text: Which of these waters is made by Gatorade?
questions.explanation:
Propel.

	Propel is another fitness water with a lot of flavor.  It keeps you hydrated, and it tastes good.  These bottles are usually blue and thick, with a twist cap like many Gatorades.  Propel was introduced in 2000 by Gatorade to specifically compete with the water market.  The goal of Gatorade was to introduce a new type of Gatorade that didn't have a lot of sugar or carbohydrates, thus expanding their market.  Many athletes didn't like all the sugar Gatorade contained, and thus Propel was put on the market.

questions.text: Which of these waters comes from the Yaqara Valley?
questions.explanation:
Fiji Water.

	Fiji water comes from the Fiji Islands.  It was originally founded in 1996 by David Gilmour, but it wasn't introduced in the United States until 1997.

questions.text: Which of these waters was originally distributed only in Wichita, Kansas?
questions.explanation:
Aquafina.

	Aquafina was first sold in Kansas in 1994.  In 2003, it became known as the United States' top selling brand of water.  Aquafina is made by PepsiCo.

questions.text: Which of these waters is made from tap water, and is distributed by Coca-Cola?
questions.explanation:
Dasani.

	Dasani was launched in 1999 to compete with Aquafina.  Dasani is made by filtering tap water around local municipal water supplies.  Dasani also comes in many different flavors, and uses artificial sweeteners.  Dasani has also made lip chap.

questions.text: Which of these companies makes Brisk iced tea?
questions.explanation:
Lipton.

	Lipton has been around since 1890, but it didn't sell iced tea in bottles and cans until 1972.  Brisk tea is more commonly found in cans, but many flavors, including the white teas, are usually found in bottles.  The most common flavor is lemon, but there are several other flavors.  Remember, tea is mostly water!

questions.text: What is the most common bottlecap color for Aquafina in the US?
questions.explanation:
White.

	Most water bottles in the US have white bottlecaps.  Some companies, however, make different colors of bottlecaps.  Dasani, for example, usually use blue bottlecaps.  However, white is the most popular bottlecap color, commonly found on Aquafina.

questions.text: Which of these companies makes a water from a spring found in the San Bernardino Mountains?
questions.explanation:
Arrowhead.

	Arrowhead Mountain Spring water was first made in 1884 under the name "Puritas," and changed the name to Arrowhead in 1905.  In 1932, it was named the official water of the Olympic Games, and again in 1984.
